task.title: Task: Update query
task.shortdesc: An example of a simple update query that changes the values in a field for all records which satisfy a certain condition.

context.p: The costs of all pralines with chocolate type white should be increased by 10 %.

All necessary data is in table Pralines. You need the fields ChocolateType and PralineCosts. Selecting the white chocolate types can be done by adding a criterion to the query. You can increase the PralineCosts by 10% by multiplying the current value with 1.1.

taskbody.prereq: Make a backup (copy) of the table, so you can restore the original situation. Another possibility is to backup (copy) the whole database.

step.cmd: Choose tab Create Query Design (group Queries) .
step.stepresult:
Access creates a new blank query window and displays the dialog box Show Table. Dialog box Show Table
Dialog box show table

step.cmd: Add table Pralines and then clickClose.
step.stepresult: The table has been added to the query window.

step.cmd: Add successively the fields ChocolateType and PralineCosts to the grid toe by double clicking on the field.
Change the query type with tab Design Update (group Query Type) .
step.stepresult:
The Sort and Show rows disappear and there is a new row Update To. Tables and fields for update query
Tables and fields for update query

step.cmd: Click in the box Criteria under column ChocolateType and type White.
Click in box Update To under column PralineCostsand type [PralineCosts]*1.1.

stepresult.note: Access surrounds text with double quotes. Field names must be surrounded by square brackets.

step.cmd: Save the query with button Save () on the Quick Access Toolbar top left and name the query Increase costs white chocolates with 10%.

step.stepresult: A dialog appears asking for confirmation.
